intro: Beilschmiedia madang, commonly known as the Madang beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the islands of the Bismarck Archipelago in Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its smooth, dark-brown bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by dark purple berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
